name: places/ChIJtTK5_KtZwokRYOQ4vcX8S7Q
adrFormatAddress: 1370 Broadway # 800, New York, NY 10018, USA

originalText.text: Do not order clothing from Gerber. If I could give them 0 stars I would. They have very limited customer service available. I called on two occasions and both times the same person answered. She was unable to help me with any other information other than look up my order and tell me if it had shipped or not, which was the same information I had access to via email. I called to inquire on when my order would be shipped as it had already day been two days and my order still hadn’t shipped. She reviewed the order and said she didn’t know when it would ship, but from what she could see the order wasn’t even put together yet. I then asked her to cancel the order because their process seemed a bit slow. I also asked questions pertaining to how the cancellation worked. She was unable to provide me with any information and could only tell me she would send an email to that department because she wasn’t sure how that process worked. She also informed me that the only way I could speak with that department is if they called me. About 4 hours after our call I received an email saying my order had been shipped so I called back and the same lady answered. I told her my order had shipped and asked if she could override the original request to cancel the order. Again, all she could do was send an email to that department because she had no information on whether that was possible or how that process worked and I would have to wait for them to call me to find out. I asked her if they had a turn around time for returning calls and she stated she did not know. Basically the customer service department knows nothing other than whether your order shipped or not. If you have any other questions or concerns you have to wait for whichever department to call you and there is no time frame in which they will call you back. So as of right now, I have two requests sitting in the inbox of whichever department deals with refunds. I have a cancellation  request and a request to not cancel as well as a request for a returned telephone call. Depending on which request they receive first will determine whether I get my package or not. In the meantime I am unsure if I need to go elsewhere to purchase clothes for my child that is due soon or if I Will receive a call and my package. Very, very, sloppy. Customer Service should have more knowledge of how the business they are working for operates.

originalText.text: 2 stars only because I only received half of my order and what was received was good.  2 + weeks after the order date, I reached out through email on the other item ordered. Response was next day that it will ship soon. Another week after that... now over 3 weeks from my order date, I email again. 3 days later I received a reply that the item is out of stock and they will issue a refund. Disappointed disappointed disappointed. Really wanted the crib sheet, gift for sister due now in 2 weeks. Over 3 weeks from order date and I have to reach out 2x on status of order to tell me it’s out of stock..... poor. Refund isn’t worth inconvenience of trying to find and order another crib sheet with limited time before the baby arrives.

originalText.text: The worst company ever. My got cancelled each time I order something. I keep calling this company no customer service answer the call. Why I send an email the only thing I've been told here is a link where you can go see if they have what you want. Very unprofessional.

originalText.text: I ordered on October 3, 2018 and it's October 10  and I'm  still waiting to get info about my order let alone it being shipped. I called several times and athena representatives are rude and treat you like you shouldn't be calling. It feels like a scam so far and I spent 200.  Thinking if getting the fraud squad involved.No one ever calls me back or even emails.

originalText.text: Never use your email address with them.  You will receive continuous emails from them which you cannot stop unless you write a letter to the company.  Who ever heard of such a thing.  Strongly recommend you move on to another company.
